headline: DOJ opens criminal probe into Russia investigation
subHeadline: Criminal review of Russia probe; reaction and analysis on 'The Five.'

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello everyone. I'm Dana Perino along with Kennedy, Geraldo Rivera, Lawrence Jones and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5:00 in New York City. This is “The Five.” Get ready to learn some very bad things. President Trump reacting to major developments in a DOJ review of the start of the Russia probe is now a criminal investigation. The change is significant because gives U.S. Attorney John Durham the power to subpoena witnesses and panel grand juries and file charges.  We're also learning that Durham's investigation has expanded because of new evidence and he is very interested in talking to former Obama intelligence officials John Brennan and James Clapper. The president weighed in earlier.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: And it looks like it's becoming very serious from what I'm hearing. Investigate the investigators, whether it's Strzok and Page, whether it's Clapper and whether it's Comey and all of these people, because terrible things went on for our country. And we have a great attorney general, highly prestigious man, a very honorable man and they've been looking at it for a long time. I can't tell you what is happening. I will tell you this. I think you're going to see a lot of really bad things.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Geraldo, it is a significant development and the president is saying he's going to leave it to the attorney general, but he's giving all of these hints that he might have been told what's going on.

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, HOST
utterances.sentences: Well, that is a probability I would guess, Dana. But the substance of the answer is that there are some night sweat epidemics going on in Washington right now. There are people who have been pressing this false narrative for over two years, this whole Russia hoax.   At some point they had to know there was no there there, and yet they carried on and issuing all of these subpoenas, all of these perjury traps, wearing, you know, hidden microphones into meetings with the president of the United States and his staffers, creating a climate of terror in the White House. All of it false, the collusion narrative, the hoax for over two years and $45 million who were led down this path. You know, Russia, Russia, Russia, it became a bad joke. How the president maintains his sanity throughout this ordeal is a great mystery. I think that the people that engineered this, the people who crafted this hoax, the people who drew the country down this -- into Oz will at some point have to pay the piper. I have no doubt.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wait. Did someone actually wear a wire inside the Oval Office?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Remember Rod Rosenstein said that he --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, but he said it was a joke like --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: It was not a joke.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, but we're not saying that -- we're not saying here that somebody wore a wire inside the Oval Office.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: How did they get General Flynn? How did they catch him?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't have --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I mean, how did they --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But I mean,, I have never heard that somebody actually wore a wire inside the Oval Office.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I stand literally corrected although my general point is well- made.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That they leaked stuff, indeed. All right

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That they entrap people. They did everything possible.

utterances.speaker: LISA KENNEDY MONTGOMERY, HOST
utterances.sentences: I don't even think -- I don't think Rod Rosenstein was joking when he said that. I think it's one of those things I think that's how you try and get trouble together. You go, how about the three of us get married. Just kidding, but I'm not. I think that's what Rod Rosenstein was doing that. But now it's very interesting because I don't think he was trying to engage in any sort of new marital concoction, but what I am saying is there were forces working against the president and it's now looking as though some of these things that at one point in our very recent path we would call conspiracy theories are bearing out in a way that it's happening so quickly with such depth and breadth. It's hard to wrap your head around. And you understand the forcefulness with which the president defends himself because he really feels like he was unfairly painted into a corner and someone really went after him. And I appreciate the tenacity with which Geraldo defends him, although, I feel like I was sitting next to Jesse Watters.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Rod Rosenstein isn't apparently a part of the new investigation. Greg, they want to talk to James Clapper and Brennan from the Obama administration.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, -- what I -- do you mind if I bash the media?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't do it very often.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Just for a change.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm going to take a break. OK. I love how the media is saying, you know, this investigation to the Russian probe is just another conspiracy theory and they mock the Republicans for this conspiracy theory. It's like the real housewives of New Jersey calling you trashy, all right.  They've been pushing conspiracies for three years. They push them more than Mike Lindell pushes pillows. Here's the deal. This impeachment is predicated on the point that they know that they can't win an election so they're like the stupid kid who is terrified of failing a final. So what does he do? He calls in a bomb threat. This is their bomb threat. This is their way of not facing the music, not facing an election. But there's good news here, I think. I think the tide is turning against the Democrats because the process is so out of proportion to the infraction. There's so much effort to produce so little. It reminds me of the Oscars, right. It starts out interesting like you're watching the Oscars the first half an hour is great.   But when it's over, when the Oscars are over, you only remember one thing. How it went on too long, how bloated and grotesque it was, how pointless and how it wasted your time. That's how this process is going to look to America. The longer it goes on, the more likely the American public will detest it because you treat it like the Oscars, get it over with.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And go to commercial break.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Not yet.

utterances.speaker: LAWRENCE JONES, CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: I think the Dems have a big problem though because when you look at them, they're teeing up for what they've said that the DOJ has lost its independence. They said that this is political revenge. And when I really look at it, they're against the good old boy system, right? And I don't mean to bash government workers, but within the Department of Justice, there is a good old boy system. They protect themselves.  But Jonathan Durham is not one of those guys. Durham is a guy that is one that has investigated them before, investigated the CIA before. And so this is a guy that was good enough for Holder, he's good enough for Trump as well, a guy that has bipartisan support, but has staked his career after going after corruption.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He did, but on the CIA --

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Correct.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He declined. He said that they did nothing wrong.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: And the CIA has lawyered up, which typically they're not -- right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, but I'm talking about his previous investigation found no criminal wrongdoing by the CIA officers.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. We have something else though because the battle over impeachment is still raging. Republicans have been demanding that the whistleblower testify publicly. But now, Democrats are reportedly claiming that hearing from the whistleblower is no longer necessary. It comes as the left and the media continue to mock and attack the GOP after they stormed the closed-door hearing this week.

utterances.speaker: KEITH BOYKIN, CNN POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: This looked like a Klan group that has assembled outside of a jail trying to get the sheriff to let them in so they could deliver their own justice against somebody who was inside. It's not a good look for our democracy. It's not a good look for the Republican Party.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And AOC is joining in calling it a little flash mob of entitlement of privilege. Greg, they did a stunt. They're trying to make a point. They actually won the news cycle for the day. Did it look like the Klan?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: How can it be a Klan if there are no Democrats? It was all Republicans. I mean, I seem to remember the Klan was made up of Democrats. Look, you know what kills me about --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That's not (INAUDIBLE). This was racist. This was a racist comment. That man was a racist -- that was a racist comment.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, so it is. I kind of agreed, but what I find interesting, Geraldo, and I think you'll find this interesting as well --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Let me see.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. When faced with real mobs, right, chasing people out of restaurants, going to people's homes, hitting Trump supporters. If you called them the mob, it was the media that called you racist. Remember, you weren't supposed to use the M word. That was only like two months ago.  But now, you see some guys and some women, politicians, lawmakers go to a meeting and they call that a mob of white people, the Klan. So you're right. I agree with you and you agree with me. Let's got get a drink.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Republicans should be more diverse, there's no doubt about it, but you get what the point is. The point is that there are a lot of Republicans who feel this process is grotesquely unfair.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And you know, I -- you know, they say it's about process. It isn't about process. It's about due process. The president gets due process. You can't do it in private. You didn't do it in private in '98. You didn't do it in private in '74 and they can't do it in private now. I say the president should do nothing to cooperate with these people unless and until they open those hearings.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You should be his lawyer.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I feel very strongly about this. And to Kennedy's point that I sound like Jesse Waters, I think that all Americans should be offended by the fact that we sang this Russia dance for two and a half years and spent this money for nothing because they -- of what? The Steele dossier? The golden (inaudible)? What did they base this on in?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: The problem is --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wait, what's that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't know what you're talking about.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: I like the Golden Corral. It's a wonderful buffet. My sister loves that restaurant so much.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: So does my grandmother.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They're going to have public hearings in November.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Well, they're going to have public hearings but I think this is a time for Americans and lawmakers to re-evaluate their past decisions. Everybody loved the FISA court. For so long, Republicans and Democrats rallied around for the FISA court when many libertarians said don't trust that court, right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: It's not enough -- see, me and you disagree on that. But there's no due process. And so now we have instances like this where Americans are spied on, a sham investigation, and all they could say is, look, at least we go a warrant from the FISA court.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, we do know --

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: That's what they need.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- is that Michael Horowitz, the inspector general at the Department of Justice says, I think it's probably within the next couple of weeks or so that we're going to have his report that focuses only on the FBI's role and the Justice Department's role.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Yes, but now -- OK, but now it's very interesting because there are Republicans who are conveniently talking about things like the deep state and talking about the surveillance apparatus in a way that they're offended by, yet they were the ones who allowed the state to get this bloated. And they realize people in power, all you have to do is set a couple of traps in secret -- this is completely opaque. We have no idea how this court works. We really don't know how the application process works or what kind of oversight they have once an application is OK and you can essentially --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, maybe they'll change some policies and procedures

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, the other thing too is, doesn't it --

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Libertarians have been begging Republicans to do that for years.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I know, but -- there might -- we don't know what the results of this or maybe there was a problem with this particular one. I don't think that means that the entire FISA court process of which has been very useful in terms of protecting national security should be thrown out with like --

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: I think we could audit it and open it.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: There just has to be a different way. And also, where is the FISA judge? Where is the FISA judge? What you are lied to -- you are lied to --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: No. If the judge was lied to -- but if the judge was lied to --

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Bring him back in.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, that's what the investigation by the I.G. will uncover.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Yes. The judge also has the authority to do it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I bet they did wiretap the Trump Tower. We could see it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well the Trump Tower is different than the Oval Office. Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVER
utterances.sentences: I bet they did wiretap the Trump Tower. I bet all of the -- all of the paranoia will come true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. I'm just interested in like how convenient is it not to need the whistleblower anymore? The whistleblower shows up, blows his whistle and then they -- so what they need is an impeachment

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: New investigation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- to find the crime that the whistleblower announced. So now that they have the crime, the whistle-blower can leave.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think the whistleblower was a FISA judge.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And that's who it is.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: I think its John Bolton and his in cahoots with Adam Schiff.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I think it's a professional Democrat. I think it's a media matters type person.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We don't know, but we know that Hillary Clinton reportedly wants in on 2020 but some Democrats are saying oh, no, not so fast. That's next.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Welcome back to our 2020 roundup. Senate Democrats warning Hillary Clinton do not do it. Senator Clinton reportedly considering a rematch with President Trump and her old colleagues in the Senate making it clear they don't want her to run. They say her time has passed and it would be a big mistake. Wouldn't it, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, they're trying to be super polite. If you read some of the quotes from the senators like, you know, I think our field is pretty set and you know maybe we should move on, but pretty much if you read between the lines, it's like, heck no, lady. Like, please just move on.  I talked to one very senior Democratic adviser who is not affiliated with any campaign this time around. And I said is this really true? And he said, ultimately he does not think that she will run but that right now she is talking to everybody and I was really stunned by that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: What's a young people think about Hillary Clinton coming back?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, that's a good question. Talk about ages, Geraldo. My god.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: That was good though.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What's a person of color, Lawrence?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Yes, right. That is actually good because this goes to the point I was getting ready to make. She's going to depress the vote if she considered going in, right? Because there are a lot of people that -- even when Obama came out and said the black votes. Get out there -- and women -- get out there and vote.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: They didn't.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: They didn't show up. They didn't show up in large numbers, and so her considering this I think goes back to her bitterness. She really believes that she was robbed of the last election. She really does. She believed like the Russians and James Comey and everybody was against her. And she didn't get a fair shake because she was a woman. And all of these forces were going against her. She does not accept that it was the American voters.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But she was robbed in the sense the Electoral College robbed her.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: No, but that darn constitution. Oh heck! Man, we have to play by rules now? Yes, that was very inconvenient for her and she should have paid a little bit more attention to the Midwest like her husband told her to. Like those horrible Trump-voting women, their husbands told them to vote for Donald Trump. That was one of the excuses that she listed. So my mom voted for Hillary Clinton. She's a life-long Democrat and she did it holding her nose. She -- sorry mom, I outed you. But she doesn't really like her. And I'm wondering how other women like my mom and other voters would feel about Hillary getting in the race and elbowing Amy Klobuchar and Marianne Williamson and Tulsi Gabbard and Liz Warren out of the way so she can dive for the tiara. I would love to see her run because I would love to see her lose.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: What was your instant reaction when you heard it?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I've always said -- I thought she was going to be like back in because she doesn't want her obituary to be "lost to Donald Trump, but also lost to Donald Trump twice." So that's a problem. Here's my thing, people do this to me all the time what the Senate did to her. I'll go hey, I'll go to my co-workers. That's like a really fun party you're throwing. You know, you'll hate it. You'll hate it. Don't come. There's no way the top three are stepping aside for her. I believe Biden gets the nod, chooses her as V.P. and then he drops out.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: OK, I'd still go with conspiracy theory. New details emerging on Hunter Biden's overseas business dealings as his dad, Joe Biden, takes a shot at President Trump's family.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: My children are not going to have offices in the White House. My children are not going to sit in on cabinet meetings. His children, his son-in-law, et cetera, engaged in the day-to- day operations of things that they know nothing about.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I said this on "Fox and Friends." Let me lead this off. You know, I visited with Ivanka Trump and with Jared Kushner in the White House. They work for no money, they're highly skilled. Ivanka has got a million different things going on with women's rights and recognizing the rights people of color and so forth. Jared, talk about that, criminal justice reform. He helped get that through --- the whole moving of the embassy in Israel from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem. They're real high functioning people and they were there for their dad at a time when he didn't trust anybody with the rats and the snitches and the back stabbers and the vipers in the West Wing, but you know, what about kids working for their dads?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: I think Joe Biden is being completely honest and I would never have one of my kids work in the White House because there's no way they could make as much money as they could from some of these sweetheart deals in Ukraine and China and Romania. And god knows where else in the world. Hunter Biden has worked everywhere. I mean, he literally could write a tourist brochure of D.C. and all the bureaucracies because the ways his dad has helped him on. I'm not saying it's illegal. It is a little --

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: It's shady.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: It is a little shady.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: And the other Democrats, and I've been across the country talking with voters, but all the other candidate's supporters care about this issue. It's only the Biden supporters that don't care about this issue. I mean, other candidates want to attack him on this issue.  And I'm here to tell you, if they're just going to Kumbaya it, he's going to win the nomination, right? If you look at -- Biden is definitely going to win the nomination. They should hammer him on this issue. When we look at the --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Aren't they?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: No, they're not. And when you look at the Republican primary back in 2016, it was a bloodbath, right? There was no playing nice. They went very personal and it took a lot of repairing afterwards. If the Democrats really want -- if the other people really want to have a shot at this nomination, they got to attack him on this issue.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But all kids, Greg, are not created equal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thank god for that because I --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And you're only as happy as you're unhappiest kid.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- more equal than other kids.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. If I had -- if I was president and I had kids, I would make them work in the White House as janitors and I'd berate them in front of the staff.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Learn the business.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Look, Biden is getting covered in impeachment blowback. I'm sorry. If you want to undo an election, you're going down with the Schiff.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Oh.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You're going to go down with the Schiff.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And I'm in trouble for golden --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Schiff.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: So what about it, I mean --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Where is the swear word in this?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Hunter versus Ivanka and Jared. Do you see them as all equal?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No. No. Also, I don't like people's children being used as pawns in all of these, right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Unless it's a chess board.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, and that would be fun.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That would be like really fun if we do that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, use them as pawns.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I also think it's interesting. Joe Biden, he has actually expanded his lead in the last month because other Democrats have not attacked him and Trump has done it. It's actually not working in terms of --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: So Trump is elevating Biden.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, yes, but also the Democrats who also I assume they want to win the nomination they're just taking a pass and not going after him on something that is quite vulnerable.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: When do they switch though?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm not sure but Joe Biden hasn't done hardly any interviews at all. I'm really just surprised. This is the first interview he's doing as in "60 Minutes" and usually you tease out your most newsy sound bite on the Friday, and this it?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That's pretty squishy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's not a lot.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Because he doesn't have to.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: There's a hefty price tag if Elizabeth Warren does win the -- beats the odds and wins the nomination and the presidency and enacts her plans like these.

utterances.speaker: ELIZABETH WARREN, D-MASS., PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: That's why I support Medicare for all. I've got plans. I've a $2 trillion plan. I've got a $1 trillion plan Universal child care, paying for college kids and student loan debt. And yes, I'm willing to get out there and fight for it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Who's estimate, Kennedy, is this $4.2 --

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Yahoo Finance.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Yahoo Finance estimating $4.2 trillion per year if Elizabeth Warren's proposals are enacted into law. That would about double the current level of the deficit which already hit the trillion dollars.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: No, that doubles spending. I mean, that doesn't even touch what will happen to the deficit.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Can we stop calling it the plan though?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Like plan, but she has a plan.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: No, it's not a plan. If you don't know how you're going to pay for it, it's not a plan. You're just throwing stuff up. It's an idea, but if you don't know -- and everyone keeps patting her on the back.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: It's a nice idea though.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Yes. Everybody keeps patting on her back. Oh, she has so many plans.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I like the idea of it. I mean, it's nice.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.sentences: Taking care of people, that is nice. Government usually does a pretty bad job of it though.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: In a left-wing world, money grows on trees and the trees are people, you know. And a junkie never intends to rob his family or his friends at the start. They always end there. They would run out of their stash and they run out of their cash. Left-wing junkies are addicted to our money. They start with the rich and they end with the poor.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: What about right-wing junkies that pass tax proposals that only benefit the rich?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.sentences: Oh, come on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They don't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Who did that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Taxes benefit everybody, Geraldo. Tax reductions.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And tax cuts.

All of it false, the collusion narrative, the hoax for over two years and $45 million who were led down this path. You know, Russia, Russia, Russia, it became a bad joke. How the president maintains his sanity throughout this ordeal is a great mystery. I think that the people that engineered this, the people who crafted this hoax, the people who drew the country down this -- into Oz will at some point have to pay the piper. I have no doubt.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wait. Did someone actually wear a wire inside the Oval Office?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Remember Rod Rosenstein said that he --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, but he said it was a joke like --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It was not a joke.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, but we're not saying that -- we're not saying here that somebody wore a wire inside the Oval Office.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: How did they get General Flynn? How did they catch him?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't have --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I mean, how did they --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But I mean,, I have never heard that somebody actually wore a wire inside the Oval Office.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I stand literally corrected although my general point is well- made.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That they leaked stuff, indeed. All right

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: That they entrap people. They did everything possible.

utterances.speaker: LISA KENNEDY MONTGOMERY, HOST
utterances.utterance: I don't even think -- I don't think Rod Rosenstein was joking when he said that. I think it's one of those things I think that's how you try and get trouble together. You go, how about the three of us get married. Just kidding, but I'm not. I think that's what Rod Rosenstein was doing that. But now it's very interesting because I don't think he was trying to engage in any sort of new marital concoction, but what I am saying is there were forces working against the president and it's now looking as though some of these things that at one point in our very recent path we would call conspiracy theories are bearing out in a way that it's happening so quickly with such depth and breadth. It's hard to wrap your head around. And you understand the forcefulness with which the president defends himself because he really feels like he was unfairly painted into a corner and someone really went after him. And I appreciate the tenacity with which Geraldo defends him, although, I feel like I was sitting next to Jesse Watters.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Rod Rosenstein isn't apparently a part of the new investigation. Greg, they want to talk to James Clapper and Brennan from the Obama administration.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, -- what I -- do you mind if I bash the media?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't do it very often.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Just for a change.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm going to take a break. OK. I love how the media is saying, you know, this investigation to the Russian probe is just another conspiracy theory and they mock the Republicans for this conspiracy theory. It's like the real housewives of New Jersey calling you trashy, all right. They've been pushing conspiracies for three years. They push them more than Mike Lindell pushes pillows. Here's the deal. This impeachment is predicated on the point that they know that they can't win an election so they're like the stupid kid who is terrified of failing a final. So what does he do? He calls in a bomb threat. This is their bomb threat. This is their way of not facing the music, not facing an election. But there's good news here, I think. I think the tide is turning against the Democrats because the process is so out of proportion to the infraction. There's so much effort to produce so little. It reminds me of the Oscars, right. It starts out interesting like you're watching the Oscars the first half an hour is great. But when it's over, when the Oscars are over, you only remember one thing. How it went on too long, how bloated and grotesque it was, how pointless and how it wasted your time. That's how this process is going to look to America. The longer it goes on, the more likely the American public will detest it because you treat it like the Oscars, get it over with.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And go to commercial break.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Not yet.

utterances.speaker: LAWRENCE JONES, CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: I think the Dems have a big problem though because when you look at them, they're teeing up for what they've said that the DOJ has lost its independence. They said that this is political revenge. And when I really look at it, they're against the good old boy system, right? And I don't mean to bash government workers, but within the Department of Justice, there is a good old boy system. They protect themselves. But Jonathan Durham is not one of those guys. Durham is a guy that is one that has investigated them before, investigated the CIA before. And so this is a guy that was good enough for Holder, he's good enough for Trump as well, a guy that has bipartisan support, but has staked his career after going after corruption.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He did, but on the CIA --

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Correct.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He declined. He said that they did nothing wrong.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: And the CIA has lawyered up, which typically they're not -- right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, but I'm talking about his previous investigation found no criminal wrongdoing by the CIA officers.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. We have something else though because the battle over impeachment is still raging. Republicans have been demanding that the whistleblower testify publicly. But now, Democrats are reportedly claiming that hearing from the whistleblower is no longer necessary. It comes as the left and the media continue to mock and attack the GOP after they stormed the closed-door hearing this week.

utterances.speaker: KEITH BOYKIN, CNN POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.utterance: This looked like a Klan group that has assembled outside of a jail trying to get the sheriff to let them in so they could deliver their own justice against somebody who was inside. It's not a good look for our democracy. It's not a good look for the Republican Party.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And AOC is joining in calling it a little flash mob of entitlement of privilege. Greg, they did a stunt. They're trying to make a point. They actually won the news cycle for the day. Did it look like the Klan?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How can it be a Klan if there are no Democrats? It was all Republicans. I mean, I seem to remember the Klan was made up of Democrats. Look, you know what kills me about --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: That's not (INAUDIBLE). This was racist. This was a racist comment. That man was a racist -- that was a racist comment.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, so it is. I kind of agreed, but what I find interesting, Geraldo, and I think you'll find this interesting as well --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Let me see.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. When faced with real mobs, right, chasing people out of restaurants, going to people's homes, hitting Trump supporters. If you called them the mob, it was the media that called you racist. Remember, you weren't supposed to use the M word. That was only like two months ago. But now, you see some guys and some women, politicians, lawmakers go to a meeting and they call that a mob of white people, the Klan. So you're right. I agree with you and you agree with me. Let's got get a drink.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Republicans should be more diverse, there's no doubt about it, but you get what the point is. The point is that there are a lot of Republicans who feel this process is grotesquely unfair.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And you know, I -- you know, they say it's about process. It isn't about process. It's about due process. The president gets due process. You can't do it in private. You didn't do it in private in '98. You didn't do it in private in '74 and they can't do it in private now. I say the president should do nothing to cooperate with these people unless and until they open those hearings.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You should be his lawyer.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I feel very strongly about this. And to Kennedy's point that I sound like Jesse Waters, I think that all Americans should be offended by the fact that we sang this Russia dance for two and a half years and spent this money for nothing because they -- of what? The Steele dossier? The golden (inaudible)? What did they base this on in?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: The problem is --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wait, what's that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know what you're talking about.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: I like the Golden Corral. It's a wonderful buffet. My sister loves that restaurant so much.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: So does my grandmother.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They're going to have public hearings in November.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Well, they're going to have public hearings but I think this is a time for Americans and lawmakers to re-evaluate their past decisions. Everybody loved the FISA court. For so long, Republicans and Democrats rallied around for the FISA court when many libertarians said don't trust that court, right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: It's not enough -- see, me and you disagree on that. But there's no due process. And so now we have instances like this where Americans are spied on, a sham investigation, and all they could say is, look, at least we go a warrant from the FISA court.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, we do know --

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: That's what they need.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- is that Michael Horowitz, the inspector general at the Department of Justice says, I think it's probably within the next couple of weeks or so that we're going to have his report that focuses only on the FBI's role and the Justice Department's role.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Yes, but now -- OK, but now it's very interesting because there are Republicans who are conveniently talking about things like the deep state and talking about the surveillance apparatus in a way that they're offended by, yet they were the ones who allowed the state to get this bloated. And they realize people in power, all you have to do is set a couple of traps in secret -- this is completely opaque. We have no idea how this court works. We really don't know how the application process works or what kind of oversight they have once an application is OK and you can essentially --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, maybe they'll change some policies and procedures

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, the other thing too is, doesn't it --

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Libertarians have been begging Republicans to do that for years.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I know, but -- there might -- we don't know what the results of this or maybe there was a problem with this particular one. I don't think that means that the entire FISA court process of which has been very useful in terms of protecting national security should be thrown out with like --

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: I think we could audit it and open it.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: There just has to be a different way. And also, where is the FISA judge? Where is the FISA judge? What you are lied to -- you are lied to --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: No. If the judge was lied to -- but if the judge was lied to --

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Bring him back in.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, that's what the investigation by the I.G. will uncover.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Yes. The judge also has the authority to do it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I bet they did wiretap the Trump Tower. We could see it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well the Trump Tower is different than the Oval Office. Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVER
utterances.utterance: I bet they did wiretap the Trump Tower. I bet all of the -- all of the paranoia will come true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I'm just interested in like how convenient is it not to need the whistleblower anymore? The whistleblower shows up, blows his whistle and then they -- so what they need is an impeachment

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: New investigation.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- to find the crime that the whistleblower announced. So now that they have the crime, the whistle-blower can leave.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think the whistleblower was a FISA judge.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And that's who it is.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: I think its John Bolton and his in cahoots with Adam Schiff.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I think it's a professional Democrat. I think it's a media matters type person.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We don't know, but we know that Hillary Clinton reportedly wants in on 2020 but some Democrats are saying oh, no, not so fast. That's next.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Welcome back to our 2020 roundup. Senate Democrats warning Hillary Clinton do not do it. Senator Clinton reportedly considering a rematch with President Trump and her old colleagues in the Senate making it clear they don't want her to run. They say her time has passed and it would be a big mistake. Wouldn't it, Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, they're trying to be super polite. If you read some of the quotes from the senators like, you know, I think our field is pretty set and you know maybe we should move on, but pretty much if you read between the lines, it's like, heck no, lady. Like, please just move on. I talked to one very senior Democratic adviser who is not affiliated with any campaign this time around. And I said is this really true? And he said, ultimately he does not think that she will run but that right now she is talking to everybody and I was really stunned by that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: What's a young people think about Hillary Clinton coming back?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, that's a good question. Talk about ages, Geraldo. My god.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: That was good though.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What's a person of color, Lawrence?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Yes, right. That is actually good because this goes to the point I was getting ready to make. She's going to depress the vote if she considered going in, right? Because there are a lot of people that -- even when Obama came out and said the black votes. Get out there -- and women -- get out there and vote.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: They didn't.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: They didn't show up. They didn't show up in large numbers, and so her considering this I think goes back to her bitterness. She really believes that she was robbed of the last election. She really does. She believed like the Russians and James Comey and everybody was against her. And she didn't get a fair shake because she was a woman. And all of these forces were going against her. She does not accept that it was the American voters.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But she was robbed in the sense the Electoral College robbed her.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: No, but that darn constitution. Oh heck! Man, we have to play by rules now? Yes, that was very inconvenient for her and she should have paid a little bit more attention to the Midwest like her husband told her to. Like those horrible Trump-voting women, their husbands told them to vote for Donald Trump. That was one of the excuses that she listed. So my mom voted for Hillary Clinton. She's a life-long Democrat and she did it holding her nose. She -- sorry mom, I outed you. But she doesn't really like her. And I'm wondering how other women like my mom and other voters would feel about Hillary getting in the race and elbowing Amy Klobuchar and Marianne Williamson and Tulsi Gabbard and Liz Warren out of the way so she can dive for the tiara. I would love to see her run because I would love to see her lose.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: What was your instant reaction when you heard it?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I've always said -- I thought she was going to be like back in because she doesn't want her obituary to be "lost to Donald Trump, but also lost to Donald Trump twice." So that's a problem. Here's my thing, people do this to me all the time what the Senate did to her. I'll go hey, I'll go to my co-workers. That's like a really fun party you're throwing. You know, you'll hate it. You'll hate it. Don't come. There's no way the top three are stepping aside for her. I believe Biden gets the nod, chooses her as V.P. and then he drops out.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: OK, I'd still go with conspiracy theory. New details emerging on Hunter Biden's overseas business dealings as his dad, Joe Biden, takes a shot at President Trump's family.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, D-PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: My children are not going to have offices in the White House. My children are not going to sit in on cabinet meetings. His children, his son-in-law, et cetera, engaged in the day-to- day operations of things that they know nothing about.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I said this on "Fox and Friends." Let me lead this off. You know, I visited with Ivanka Trump and with Jared Kushner in the White House. They work for no money, they're highly skilled. Ivanka has got a million different things going on with women's rights and recognizing the rights people of color and so forth. Jared, talk about that, criminal justice reform. He helped get that through --- the whole moving of the embassy in Israel from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem. They're real high functioning people and they were there for their dad at a time when he didn't trust anybody with the rats and the snitches and the back stabbers and the vipers in the West Wing, but you know, what about kids working for their dads?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: I think Joe Biden is being completely honest and I would never have one of my kids work in the White House because there's no way they could make as much money as they could from some of these sweetheart deals in Ukraine and China and Romania. And god knows where else in the world. Hunter Biden has worked everywhere. I mean, he literally could write a tourist brochure of D.C. and all the bureaucracies because the ways his dad has helped him on. I'm not saying it's illegal. It is a little --

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: It's shady.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: It is a little shady.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: And the other Democrats, and I've been across the country talking with voters, but all the other candidate's supporters care about this issue. It's only the Biden supporters that don't care about this issue. I mean, other candidates want to attack him on this issue. And I'm here to tell you, if they're just going to Kumbaya it, he's going to win the nomination, right? If you look at -- Biden is definitely going to win the nomination. They should hammer him on this issue. When we look at the --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Aren't they?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: No, they're not. And when you look at the Republican primary back in 2016, it was a bloodbath, right? There was no playing nice. They went very personal and it took a lot of repairing afterwards. If the Democrats really want -- if the other people really want to have a shot at this nomination, they got to attack him on this issue.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But all kids, Greg, are not created equal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank god for that because I --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And you're only as happy as you're unhappiest kid.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- more equal than other kids.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. If I had -- if I was president and I had kids, I would make them work in the White House as janitors and I'd berate them in front of the staff.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Learn the business.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Look, Biden is getting covered in impeachment blowback. I'm sorry. If you want to undo an election, you're going down with the Schiff.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Oh.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You're going to go down with the Schiff.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And I'm in trouble for golden --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Schiff.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: So what about it, I mean --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Where is the swear word in this?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Hunter versus Ivanka and Jared. Do you see them as all equal?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No. No. Also, I don't like people's children being used as pawns in all of these, right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Unless it's a chess board.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, and that would be fun.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That would be like really fun if we do that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, use them as pawns.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I also think it's interesting. Joe Biden, he has actually expanded his lead in the last month because other Democrats have not attacked him and Trump has done it. It's actually not working in terms of --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: So Trump is elevating Biden.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, yes, but also the Democrats who also I assume they want to win the nomination they're just taking a pass and not going after him on something that is quite vulnerable.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: When do they switch though?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm not sure but Joe Biden hasn't done hardly any interviews at all. I'm really just surprised. This is the first interview he's doing as in "60 Minutes" and usually you tease out your most newsy sound bite on the Friday, and this it?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: That's pretty squishy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's not a lot.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Because he doesn't have to.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: There's a hefty price tag if Elizabeth Warren does win the -- beats the odds and wins the nomination and the presidency and enacts her plans like these.

utterances.speaker: ELIZABETH WARREN, D-MASS., PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: That's why I support Medicare for all. I've got plans. I've a $2 trillion plan. I've got a $1 trillion plan Universal child care, paying for college kids and student loan debt. And yes, I'm willing to get out there and fight for it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Who's estimate, Kennedy, is this $4.2 --

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Yahoo Finance.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Yahoo Finance estimating $4.2 trillion per year if Elizabeth Warren's proposals are enacted into law. That would about double the current level of the deficit which already hit the trillion dollars.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: No, that doubles spending. I mean, that doesn't even touch what will happen to the deficit.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Can we stop calling it the plan though?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Like plan, but she has a plan.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: No, it's not a plan. If you don't know how you're going to pay for it, it's not a plan. You're just throwing stuff up. It's an idea, but if you don't know -- and everyone keeps patting her on the back.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It's a nice idea though.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Yes. Everybody keeps patting on her back. Oh, she has so many plans.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I like the idea of it. I mean, it's nice.

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Taking care of people, that is nice. Government usually does a pretty bad job of it though.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: In a left-wing world, money grows on trees and the trees are people, you know. And a junkie never intends to rob his family or his friends at the start. They always end there. They would run out of their stash and they run out of their cash. Left-wing junkies are addicted to our money. They start with the rich and they end with the poor.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: What about right-wing junkies that pass tax proposals that only benefit the rich?

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Oh, come on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They don't.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Who did that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Taxes benefit everybody, Geraldo. Tax reductions.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And tax cuts.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tax cuts.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: At the highest income levels?

utterances.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterances.utterance: Fine. Go for it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Why not?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Cut away. Trim, trim, trim.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: That's also not spending. That's giving your money back.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Bruce Springsteen attacking President Trump over what it means to be an American. That's next.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: And I didn't need Beyonce and Jay-z. I didn't need little Bruce Springsteen and all of these people. They got all of these people.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: That was President Trump mocking celebrity endorsements like when Bruce Springsteen backed Hillary Clinton in 2016. Now, the boss is hitting back with this dig at Trump.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE SPRINGSTEEN, MUSICIAN
utterances.utterance: We're living in a frightening time. The stewardship of the nation has been thrown away to somebody who doesn't have a clue as to what that means. And unfortunately, we have somebody who I feel doesn't have a grasp of the deep meaning of what it means to be an American.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Greg, you were in the celebrity world with them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I am a celebrity.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Do they actually believe that you're --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm a world -- Lawrence, I'm a world class celebrity and I'm a little insulted that you didn't say that from the start.

utterances.speaker: JONES
utterances.utterance: Right. Do they believe that they have this much power?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
